explanations.a: Phosphates are the primary form of phosphorus in soil.
explanations.b: Phosphides are not common in soil.
explanations.c: Elementary phosphorus is not typically found in soil.
explanations.d: Phosphanes are not common in soil.

questions.question: In which form is phosphorus absorbed by plants from soil?

explanations.a: H3PO3 is not absorbed by plants.
explanations.b: P4S10 is not a plant-available form.
explanations.c: HPO2 is not absorbed by plants.
explanations.d: H2PO4- is one of the main forms absorbed by plants.

questions.question: At higher soil pH, most phosphorus is in the form of

explanations.a: Phosphorus binds with calcium at higher pH.
explanations.b: Sulfur compounds are unrelated to phosphorus availability.
explanations.d: Too general; specific compounds are formed.

questions.question: Maximum phosphorus availability is at a pH range ..........

explanations.b: Too alkaline for maximum phosphorus availability.
explanations.d: Too acidic for most phosphorus forms.

questions.question: Which of the following is a major component of soil?

explanations.a: Important but not the largest portion.
explanations.c: Essential for processes, but less volume.
explanations.d: Makes up the largest percentage of soil by volume.
